# 1970 Queen's Club Championships – Men's doubles__disambig_1

Tom Okker Marty Riessen
| runner   =  Arthur Ashe Charlie Pasarell
| score    = 6–4, 6–4
| draw     = 27
| edition  =
| type     =
}}
Owen Davidson and Dennis Ralston were the defending champions, but did not participate together this year.
Tom Okker and Marty Riessen won the title, defeating Arthur Ashe and Charlie Pasarell 6–4, 6–4 in the final.
Seeds
John Newcombe /  Tony Roche (quarterfinals)
#  Rod Laver /  Frew McMillan (quarterfinals)
#  Robert Lutz /  Stan Smith (semifinals)
#  Arthur Ashe /  Charlie Pasarell (final)
#  Cliff Drysdale /  Roger Taylor (quarterfinals)
#  Sergei Likhachev /  Alex Metreveli (quarterfinals)
#  Tom Okker /  Marty Riessen (champions)
#  Bill Bowrey /  Owen Davidson (semifinals)
}}
